eip_note: Maine classifies all pre-Election Day voting as “absentee” and not “early voting,” but voters can submit absentee ballots in person to their municipal clerk's office through Election Day.

vbm_note: Ballots are mailed to residents between 14 and 18 days before the election.  They must be received in a county election office or designated drop site by 8 p.m. on Election Day.
Ballots are mailed at least 18 days before the election. To vote, a ballot must either be postmarked no later than Election Day, or submitted in person by 8 p.m. on Election Day.
